title: Singa 422 Fix the error caused by protobuf version
body:
Please uninstall the old singa and protobuf, and then install singa in a virtual env.

```
conda create -n singa
conda install -c nusdbsystem singa-cpu
```

title: SINGA-422 ModuleNotFoundError: No module named '_singa_wrap'
body:
I tried to use gcc and gxx 5.4 or 7.3. However, there are various errors due to the mismatch of gcc/gxx, cuda, protobuf
versions. E.g., `CXXABI_1.3.8' not found, `GLIBCXX_3.4.20' not found.

Now the solution is to rollback the protobuf version to 3.2.0 and gcc to
4.8.5.

Ref. SINGA-396 SINGA409.

To test: Uninstall the previous singa and protobuf and install the new version.

title: SINGA-422 ModuleNotFoundError: No module named '_singa_wrap'
body:
Fix the error due to the upgrade of protobuf version which requires a
higher gcc and glib version.

title: SINGA-405 Adding maturity assessment
body: This assessment is added on the SINGA website because SINGA has no wiki on Apache Confluence or on GitHub. Once the SINGA wiki becomes ready, this page and probably other pages like the [development schedule](http://singa.apache.org/en/develop/schedule.html) and [how to release](https://github.com/apache/incubator-singa/blob/master/doc/en/develop/how-to-release.rst) should be moved there.

title: SINGA-405 Add roles to contributors
body:
This pull request is an invitation for adding the roles for each contributor in the SINGA team in order to satisfy the [Apache Maturity Model](https://community.apache.org/apache-way/apache-project-maturity-model.html):

CS10: The project maintains a public list of its contributors who have decision power -- the project's PMC (Project Management Committee) consists of those contributors.

See [this example.](http://pulsar.apache.org/team/)

Please complete the _roles_ column in this PR with missing values, because I do not have the roles of everyone.

This will also improve the voting process in SINGA because some voting results may not be accurate according to the Apache process, like [this one](http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/singa-dev/201811.mbox/%3CCAH%3DWUUb79%2Bvob%2BcBZMXAc4u4R6C6PHyjRrckPnctdhpNUggEcQ%40mail.gmail.com%3E), because the list of contributors with voting power was not made public.

title: SINGA-405 Add How to Release instructions
body:
According to [the Apache project maturity model](http://community.apache.org/apache-way/apache-project-maturity-model.html):

> RE50: The release process is documented and repeatable to the extent that someone new to the project is able to independently generate the complete set of artifacts required for a release.

ASF projects provide a page in the documentation for the release instructions. For example, see  [SystemML]( https://systemml.apache.org/docs/0.12.0/release-process) and [SkyWalking](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/How-to-release.md).

This pull request proposes a draft for SINGA release instructions. Please feel free to comment or update this draft as needed.

title: SINGA-409 [Singa 1.2.0] Basic `singa-cpu` import throws error
body:
It is due to the version mismatch of Protobuf.
In SINGA-396, we updated the protobuf version to be >=3.2.0. And the
singa package is built using 3.2.0.
However, 3.6.1 is installed in your OS. In other words, the runtime env
and the building env mismatch.
In this commit, we fix the version for both building and runtime to
3.6.1.

title: singa-onnx
body:
Hi,
I write some code for singa to read onnx model and convert singa computation graph to onnx model.
examples/autograd/mlp.py is about converting singa computation graph to onnx model
examples/autograd/mplonnx2singa.py is about converting onnx model to singa computation graph.
examples/autograd/onnx_model.py/ is some tool code for above two files.
python/singa/autograd.py, add some code for reading different layers' parameters and converting onnx model to singa computation graph

title: SINGA-383 Add Separable Convolution for autograd
body:
The former Conv2d layer connot support Grouped Convolution, which make it difficult to realize some networks like inception net, xception net.

In this ticket, i will let Conv2d layer support Grouped convolution. and implement separable_conv2d which is the basic module in xception net by calling conv2d.

SINGA-358: Consolidated RUN steps and cleaned caches in Docker contai
body:
In this PR, I propose some small changes to this project's Dockerfiles. See [SINGA-358](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SINGA-358) for a full description of what I'm proposing here.

Changes in containers:

`centos6`: 1.54GB ---> 1.48GB   (-60 MB)
`py3`:         3.33GB --> 3.31GB    (-20 MB)
`py2`:         3.32GB --> 3.3GB      (-20 MB)
`conda`:     3.36GB --> 3.26GB   (-100 MB)

title: SINGA-346 Update cudnn from V5 to V7
body:
## Update the code to call cudnn v7

4 functions in v5 not present in v7:

'cudnnActivationBackward_v4',
'cudnnActivationForward_v4',
'cudnnSetPooling2dDescriptor_v4',
'cudnnSetFilter4dDescriptor_v4'

4 functions API changed in v7:

'cudnnSetConvolution2dDescriptor',
'cudnnSetRNNDescriptor',

'cudnnSetFilterNdDescriptor',  (int to const int)
'cudnnSetTensorNdDescriptor'.  (int to const int)

## Update the Dockerfiles

Dockerfiles are moved into tool/docker folder.
The conda package generation and testing docker containers (Dockerfiles) are separated.

## Improve the compilation and test scripts

Some env variables are removed to make the compilation and test easier, including numpy path, CUDA version, etc.

title: SINGA-347 Create a function that supports einsum
body: The High dimension matrix matrix/vector calculation
